item.title: Health Benefits and Anti-Aging Effects of Licochalcone A
item.description: Opening Overview Since ancient times, flora has served as a fundamental resource for nourishment, habitat, and therapeutic remedies. Prior to the advent of contemporary scientific and medical advancements, ancient cultures heavily relied on botanical remedies. Out of approximately 390,000 identified species of plants, a mere 6% have undergone examination for their biological properties. In many developing regions, particularly within Asia and Africa, the utilization of herbal extracts for treating diseases in both humans and animals is still prevalent.
